title: 113_s2076
content: The Act may be cited as the "U.S. Merchant Marine Academy Board of Visitors Enhancement Act". United States Merchant Marine Academy Board of Visitors. The U.S. Merchant Marine Academy Board of Visitors Enhancement Act amends Section 51312 of title 46, United States Code to establish a Board of Visitors for the Academy. The Board will provide independent advice and recommendations on Academy matters and will be composed of 2 Senators and 3 members of the House of Representatives. The Board of Visitors for the U.S. Merchant Marine Academy includes 3 House members appointed by the Chairman of the Committee on Armed Services, 1 Senator appointed by the Vice President, 2 House members appointed by the Speaker, the Commander of the Military Sealift Command, and the Assistant Commandant for Prevention. The Board of Visitors for the U.S. Merchant Marine Academy includes individuals appointed by the President, ex officio members from Senate and House committees, and a non-voting member from the Academy's congressional district. The Board of Visitors for the U.S. Merchant Marine Academy includes presidential appointees, with specific requirements for their backgrounds, such as being Academy graduates or senior corporate officers from U.S. maritime shipping companies involved in relevant programs. The Board of Visitors for the U.S. Merchant Marine Academy consists of members serving biennial terms, including Senate-confirmed Presidential appointees, Senior Executive Service members, and flag-rank officers from relevant agencies. Members serve for 2 years, with vacancies filled promptly. The U.S. Merchant Marine Academy Board of Visitors consists of members serving biennial terms, including Senate-confirmed Presidential appointees, Senior Executive Service members, and flag-rank officers from relevant agencies. Vacancies are promptly filled, and current members continue to serve until their term ends. Designated Federal Officer notifies appointing officials of vacancies, who must designate replacements within 60 days. The U.S. Merchant Marine Academy Board of Visitors can designate a temporary substitute member to attend activities if unable to participate. The substitute member must be appointed by the President, a Senior Executive Service member, or a flag-rank officer. The U.S. Merchant Marine Academy Board of Visitors can appoint a temporary substitute member from the Coast Guard or Military Sealift Command to participate fully in board activities and report back within 15 days. The Board selects a member of the House of Representatives or a Senator to serve as Chairperson on a biennial basis, with alternating terms between the two. The Chairperson cannot serve more than one consecutive term. The Board meets several times each year as outlined in the Charter. The U.S. Merchant Marine Academy Board of Visitors, as outlined in the Charter, must hold at least one meeting at the Academy annually. Within 60 days of the U.S. Merchant Marine Academy Board of Visitors Enhancement Act enactment, the Designated Federal Officer will convene a meeting to select a Chairperson and establish an official Charter for the Board, ensuring multiple meetings per year. The Board of Visitors, in cooperation with the Superintendent, may visit the Academy to inquire into morale, discipline, curriculum, facilities, and other relevant matters. Members of the Board shall have access to grounds, facilities, personnel for their duties. The Secretary of Transportation shall provide support to the Board. The Secretary of Transportation shall provide necessary support to the Board of Visitors for the U.S. Merchant Marine Academy. A Designated Federal Officer will be selected within 30 days of the enactment of the Act. Staff members may serve without reimbursement as designated by the Chairperson of the Board or the chairman of the Committee on Commerce, Science. The Board of Visitors for the U.S. Merchant Marine Academy consists of the chairman of the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation of the Senate, and the chairman of the Committee on Armed Services of the House of Representatives. Members are allowed travel expenses while serving away from home. Reports must be submitted to the President after annual visits, with recommendations pertaining to the Academy. The Board of Visitors for the U.S. Merchant Marine Academy may prepare and submit reports to the President, Secretary of Transportation, and Senate Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation. They can also call in advisors for consultation or report preparation.
